form.inputPlaceholder: Where do I send my inspiration?

title.titleAriaLabel: Nature has taught me to see color, detail, and the beauty of the world.

familySection.title: Artist Family
familySection.quote: «Painting is part of our family. My parents and brother are also artists, and each of us expresses art in our own way.»

oleksiiAndWife.imgAlt: Olexei Chebotaru - Andrei's brother, with his wife Alla Kislyakova
oleksiiAndWife.name: Olexei Chebotaru and Alla Kislyakova
oleksiiAndWife.linkAriaLabel: Read more about Olexei Chebotaru and Alla Kislyakova

heroSection.heroText: Ukrainian artist, master of still life painting, who devoted her life to art and raising a creative family. Her paintings are permeated with color and light, and her pedagogical activity - a sincere love for young talents.

heroImg.imgAlt: Tamara Chebotaru is the mother of Ukrainian artist Andrei Chebotaru

stories.story1: Born May 7, 1954 in the village of Glubokoye, Odessa region.
stories.story2: Graduated from the Faculty of Art and Graphic Arts of Odessa Pedagogical Institute. She studied under Prof. V. A. Gegomyan - a student of Martiros Saryan.
stories.story3: In 1977 she began her professional activity in Sevastopol.
stories.story4: Worked as a teacher in the art studio and artist-decorator in the cultural complex “Korabel”.
stories.story5: Wife of the famous Crimean artist Nikolai Chebotaru.

listOfItems.item1: The author of a vivid and recognizable artistic style based on expressive color solutions and textural technique.
listOfItems.item2: Her still lifes have become true pictorial revelations, capable of touching not only the eye, but also the soul.
listOfItems.item3: Participant of many city, regional, all-Ukrainian and international art exhibitions.
listOfItems.item4: Works are kept in private collections and galleries in Ukraine, France, the Netherlands, Greece, Hungary and other countries.

quoteSection.text: Color is my poetry. I don't just paint an object, I look for its mood, voice, breath of light.
quoteSection.author: - Tamara Chebotaru

heroSection.heroText: Soviet and Ukrainian painter, father of Andrei Chebotaru. A painter with a pronounced impressionist handwriting, he left a noticeable trace in the fine arts of Crimea and Ukraine. His path in art is decades of teaching, creative pursuits and participation in numerous exhibitions, as well as a profound influence on the formation of his son's artistic vision.

heroImg.imgAlt: Nicolae Chebotaru is the father of Ukrainian artist Andrei Chebotaru

stories.story1: Born December 26, 1948 in the village of Glubokoye, Odessa region.
stories.story2: In 1972 he entered the Republican Art School named after I.E. Repin in Chisinau.
stories.story4: From 1976 to 1979 - teacher at a children's art school in Moldavia.
stories.story5: Since 1979 - artist in art and production workshops in Sevastopol.
stories.story6: Since 1982 - member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine.

listOfItems.item1: Participant of all-union, republican and city art exhibitions.
listOfItems.item2: His paintings are distinguished by the play of light and shadow, a lively palette and deep emotionality.
listOfItems.item3: The artist's style is close to impressionism: he subtly conveyed the atmosphere, light and mood of the landscape.
listOfItems.item4: The works are in private collections and galleries in Ukraine and abroad.
listOfItems.item5: Today continues his creative activity in Kiev.

picture1.imgAlt: Painting 'I Love the Charm of Eyes', 2021, 50×70cm
picture1.title: I Love the Eye Charm

quoteSection.text: Painting is a way to stop the moment and absorb the light. Everything else is detail.
quoteSection.author: — Nicolae Chebotaru

previewSection.previewText: Ukrainian impressionist painter who creates lively and emotional paintings.

images.imgAlt4: Stylized landscape of a village - decorative element

aboutAuthorSection.text: Andrei Chebotaru is an outstanding Ukrainian artist, a master of impressionistic landscape and still life. His works are distinguished by bold compositions, richness of color palette and bright emotional sound. He skillfully combines traditional techniques with individual vision, creating a pictorial symphony of poetry and the joy of being.

heroSection.title: Path in Art
heroSection.text: Andrei Chebotaru was born in 1984 in Sevastopol in an artistic family. His creative path began in early childhood - he grew up among brushes, canvases and sketchbooks. His artist parents, Nikolai and Tamara Chebotaru, became his first mentors.
heroSection.text2: Already at a young age Andriy began to learn the basics of composition, color and light, and in 2011, while still a student, became a member of the National Union of Artists of Ukraine.
heroSection.imgAlt: Artist Andrei Chebotaru at work on plein air in the mountains

inspirationMapSection.title: Geography of Inspiration
inspirationMapSection.text: Traveling is an important part of an artist's life. He believes that every landscape, every city, every accent of light can be the starting point for a new work.

location1.name: Montenegro. Bay of Kotor
location1.imgAlt: Montenegro landscape that inspired the artist

location2.name: France. Bay of Biscay
location2.imgAlt: French Bay of Biscay in picture

heroReverseSection.title: Education and Style Formation
heroReverseSection.text: His style palette includes the influence of Impressionism, a personal sense of color, and a desire to convey the mood of the moment. His painting combines an academic foundation with expressive color presentation as well as bold compositional decisions.

items.item1: 1995-2002 - training in a family art studio.
items.item2: 2002-2006 - Crimean Art School named after N. S. Samokish. N.S. Samokish (mentor - Grigoriev V.I.)
items.item3: 2007-2013 - National Academy of Fine Arts and Architecture (NAOMA), Faculty of Painting (supervisors: Zabashta V.I., Melnichuk I.Yu.)

heroReverseSection.heroImgAlt: Abstract painting with bright strokes - an example of Andrei Cebotaru's artistic style

quoteSection.text: Traveling is like immersing myself in a land of dreams and desires. The beautiful scenery and magical atmosphere give energy and inspiration for creativity.

stories.story1: 2011 - accepted into the National Union of Artists of Ukraine
stories.story3: 2016 - invitation with a personal project to the Council of Europe, Strasbourg (France)
stories.story4: Many commendations and diplomas for participation in exhibitions and plein airs
stories.story5: Works of the artist decorate private collections all over the world, as well as state institutions of Ukraine - for example, one of the paintings can be seen in the office of the President of Ukraine.
stories.storyImgAlt: Andrei Cebotaru receives awards and recognition for his contribution to art

previewSection.title: Oleksii Chebotaru and Alla Kislyakova
previewSection.imgAlt: Oleksii Chebotaru and Alla Kislyakova joint photo.

heroBrotherSection.title: Oleksii Chebotaru
heroBrotherSection.text: Ukrainian impressionist painter, a bright representative of the Crimean school of painting. His works are distinguished by lyricism, harmony of colors and light musicality. He actively participates in international exhibitions and auctions, and also teaches art in different countries.
heroBrotherSection.imgAlt: Oleksii Chebotaru is the brother of Andrei Chebotaru, a Ukrainian impressionist painter.

card1.title: Education and Career
card1.text1: Graduated from the National Academy of Fine Arts and Architecture (Kiev) and Crimean Art College.
card1.text2: Painting teacher with experience in Ukraine, China and Montenegro.

card2.title: Exhibitions and Achievements
card2.text1: More than 40 solo exhibitions, participation in international art symposiums and plein airs.
card2.text2: Works are in private collections in the USA, Germany, France, Great Britain and other countries.

card3.title: Style and Creativity
card3.text1: Works in the genre of impressionism: landscape, still life, portrait, genre painting.
card3.text2: Likes to work on Christian paintings and landscapes on plein air.

galleryBrotherSection.title: Gallery of works by Oleksii Chebotaru

picture2.title: Yachts in the Bay of Kotor
picture2.imgAlt: Yachts in the Bay of Kotor, 2012, 70×100cm. Author - Oleksii Chebotaru

picture3.title: Behind the Scenes
picture3.imgAlt: Behind the scenes, 2023, 95×70cm. Written by Oleksii Chebotaru

heroBrothersWifeSection.title: Alla Kislyakova
heroBrothersWifeSection.text: Professional artist-painter, member of the Union of Artists of Ukraine. Her works cover such styles as Impressionism and Expressionism. Alla actively participates in exhibitions and art symposiums, and also conducts teaching activities in Ukraine and abroad.
heroBrothersWifeSection.imgAlt: Artist Alla Kislyakova, wife of Andrei Chebotaru's brother Oleksiy.

card1.text: Odessa Art School, Faculty of Design

card2.text: Works in the genres of botanical graphics, illustration, decorative panel

card3.text: Participant in collaborative exhibitions and art residencies

card4.text: Conducts master classes and training courses on author's techniques

picture2.title: Luxury Flowers
picture2.imgAlt: Luxury Flowers” painting by Alla Kislyakova, 2020, 70×80 cm
